Understate: The claim may understate the number of Americans killed by right-wing extremists by not including deaths that occurred outside of the United States.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough support as it is based on data gathered by the New America Foundation, which has been challenged by conservatives.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the deaths attributed to right-wing extremists can be clearly linked to their ideological beliefs, which may be a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the killings by right-wing extremists, such as mental illness or personal grievances.
